meanings.definition: Fail to fulfill or undertake (a responsibility or duty)
meanings.sent1: He decided to abdicate his duty to take out the trash.
meanings.sent2: She always abdicates her responsibility to do the dishes.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to abdicate its duty to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The student's attempt to abdicate the assignment was unsuccessful.
meanings.sent5: The captain cannot abdicate his duty to steer the ship in a storm.

meanings.definition: Renounce or relinquish a throne or power
meanings.sent1: The king chose to abdicate the throne to his son.
meanings.sent2: The queen abdicated her power to rule the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly tried to abdicate his magic wand.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's decision to abdicate control of the company surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The dictator was forced to abdicate his power after a revolution.

meanings.definition: Give up or renounce a position of power or authority
meanings.sent1: The president had to abdicate his position due to scandal.
meanings.sent2: The manager decided to abdicate her authority in the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The superhero cannot abdicate his responsibility to protect the city.
meanings.sent4: The general's choice to abdicate command of the troops was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The judge was forced to abdicate her role in the trial due to a conflict of interest.
